description: The user provides a contract URL and asks for a dual‑jurisdiction venue clause with a fallback to a more enforceable venue. The assistant uploads the contract, extracts the existing venue clause, pulls similar litigation outcomes, calculates a risk score, suggests a mitigated dual‑jurisdiction clause, generates a full risk report, and returns the findings and report link to the user.

messages.content: You are LexRiskScorer, an AI‑powered legal risk scoring assistant. Use the provided tools to upload contracts, extract specific clauses, retrieve relevant litigation outcomes, calculate quantitative risk scores, suggest mitigation language, and generate a comprehensive PDF report. Communicate clearly with the user and explain each step.

I have a service agreement PDF at https://example.com/contracts/service_agreement.pdf. Please analyze the venue clause and propose a dual‑jurisdiction fallback clause that offers a more enforceable venue.
Uploading the contract so I can work with its contents.
Contract uploaded successfully. Contract ID: contract_ABC123
Extracting the existing venue clause from the uploaded contract.

Clause Title: Venue
Clause Text: "Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state courts of New York, County of New York, and the parties hereby submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts."
Retrieving litigation outcomes that involve similar venue clauses, focusing on New York jurisdiction.

arguments.clause_text: Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state courts of New York, County of New York, and the parties hereby submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts.

messages.content: [{"case_id":"C001","jurisdiction":"NY","outcome":"Plaintiff won","monetary_impact":500000,"summary":"Broad venue clause led to costly litigation"},{"case_id":"C002","jurisdiction":"CA","outcome":"Dismissed","monetary_impact":0,"summary":"Venue clause deemed unenforceable"},{"case_id":"C003","jurisdiction":"NY","outcome":"Settlement","monetary_impact":250000,"summary":"Ambiguous venue language caused settlement"}]
Calculating a quantitative risk score for the extracted venue clause based on the retrieved case data.

arguments.clause_text: Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state courts of New York, County of New York, and the parties hereby submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts.
arguments.case_summaries: [{"case_id":"C001","jurisdiction":"NY","outcome":"Plaintiff won","monetary_impact":500000,"summary":"Broad venue clause led to costly litigation"},{"case_id":"C002","jurisdiction":"CA","outcome":"Dismissed","monetary_impact":0,"summary":"Venue clause deemed unenforceable"},{"case_id":"C003","jurisdiction":"NY","outcome":"Settlement","monetary_impact":250000,"summary":"Ambiguous venue language caused settlement"}]

messages.content: {"risk_score":68,"details":"Medium‑high risk due to broad venue language and prior unfavorable outcomes in similar New York cases."}
Based on the analysis, the main risk driver is the overly broad venue clause. I will now suggest a mitigated dual‑jurisdiction clause that adds a fallback to a more enforceable venue.

arguments.clause_text: Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the state courts of New York, County of New York, and the parties hereby submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts.
arguments.risk_factors: Broad venue language; lack of fallback provision

messages.content: "Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved in the state courts of New York, County of New York, unless the dispute involves claims arising under California law, in which case the parties agree to submit to the state courts of California, County of Los Angeles. The parties hereby submit to the personal jurisdiction of the chosen court."
Generating a full risk report that includes the original clause, case references, risk score, and the suggested mitigation language.

Here are the findings for the venue clause:

- **Risk Score:** 68 (Medium‑high risk)
- **Key Risk Factor:** Broad, exclusive jurisdiction clause without a fallback provision.
- **Suggested Dual‑Jurisdiction Clause:**
  "Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved in the state courts of New York, County of New York, unless the dispute involves claims arising under California law, in which case the parties agree to submit to the state courts of California, County of Los Angeles. The parties hereby submit to the personal jurisdiction of the chosen court."
- **Relevant Litigation Cases:** The report includes three cases (C001, C002, C003) that illustrate how similar language has performed in New York and California courts.

You can download the complete PDF report, which contains the full case summaries, statistical analysis, and additional mitigation recommendations, here: https://lexriskscorer.com/reports/report_ABC123.pdf

Let me know if you’d like any further adjustments or a deeper dive into any specific case.
